title: Warm-up Guide
summary: A 10-15 minute warm-up flow to prepare joints and reduce injury risk.

sections.title: Why warm-up matters
items: Increases blood flow and raises muscle temperature.
Prepares joints for explosive, multi-directional movement.
Reduces injury risk for ankles, knees, shoulders, and wrists.

sections.title: Phase 1: Pulse Raiser (3-5 min)
items: Light jogging (2 min): around the court or in place.
High knees (30 sec): drive knees upward, pump arms.
Butt kicks (30 sec): heels touch glutes.
Side shuffles (30 sec each direction): stay low, athletic stance.
Skipping (1 min): optional, great for coordination.

sections.title: Phase 2: Joint Mobilization - Upper Body (3-4 min)
items: Neck mobility: look left/right and tilt ear to shoulder. Avoid full circle rotations.
Shoulder circles: forward and backward, 15 each direction.
Arm swings: cross-body horizontal swings, 20 reps.
Wrist rotations: interlace fingers and rotate, 20 each direction.
Elbow circles: hands on shoulders, draw circles with elbows, 10 each direction.

sections.title: Phase 2: Joint Mobilization - Lower Body (3-4 min)
items: Hip circles: hands on hips, large circles, 10 each direction.
Leg swings (front-back): 15 each leg.
Leg swings (side-to-side): 15 each leg.
Knee bends (mini squats): 15 reps, avoid grinding knee rotation.
Ankle rotations: 15 each direction per foot.

sections.title: Phase 3: Dynamic Stretching (3-4 min)
items: Walking lunges: 10 each leg.
Lateral lunges: 8 each side.
Inchworms: 6 reps.
Leg cradles: 8 each leg.
Torso twists: 15 each side.
Arm circles (large): 15 forward, 15 backward.

sections.title: Phase 4: Badminton-Specific Activation (2-3 min)
items: Shadow footwork to the four corners with split-step and recovery.
Shadow swings for forehand and backhand with rotation.
Light rally if partner available: focus on touch and movement, not power.

sections.title: Quick reference checklist
items: Pulse elevated (light sweat).
All major joints mobilized (ankles, knees, hips, shoulders, wrists).
Dynamic stretches completed (no static holds).
Badminton movements rehearsed (footwork, swings).

sections.title: Common mistakes to avoid
items: Static stretching before play.
Rushing through the warm-up.
Ignoring wrists and ankles.
Going 100 percent immediately.
